qas.question: What was the date of the first action of the Franco-Prussian War?
On that date, which elements were assisted by Prussian artillery forces?
Who initially held a strong position during the battle at the border?
Douay's initial success was credited by what?
What threatened the French avenue of retreat?

answers.text: the encirclement of the town by the Prussians

context: The first action of the Franco-Prussian War took place on <a0_0>4 August 1870<a0_0/>. This battle saw the unsupported division of <a2_0>General Douay of I Corps<a2_0/>, with some attached cavalry, which was posted to watch the border, attacked in overwhelming but uncoordinated fashion by the German 3rd Army. During the day, elements of a <a1_0>Bavarian and two Prussian corps<a1_0/> became engaged and were aided by Prussian artillery, which blasted holes in the defenses of the town. Douay held a very strong position initially, thanks to the accurate <a3_0>long-range fire of the Chassepots<a3_0/> but his force was too thinly stretched to hold it. Douay was killed in the late morning when a caisson of the divisional mitrailleuse battery exploded near him; <a4_0>the encirclement of the town by the Prussians<a4_0/> threatened the French avenue of retreat.
